price: (66) And if We willed, We could have obliterated their eyes, and they would race to [find] the path, and how could they see?[1277]
arabic: وَلَوۡ نَشَآءُ لَطَمَسۡنَا عَلَىٰٓ أَعۡيُنِهِمۡ فَٱسۡتَبَقُواْ ٱلصِّرَٰطَ فَأَنَّىٰ يُبۡصِرُونَ
footnotes: [1277]- Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) could have left man without means of guidance in the life of this world, although in His mercy He did not.

version.title: English Translation - Saheeh International
version.description: Translation of the Quran meanings into English - Saheeh International - Al-Muntada Al-Islami (Islamic Forum)

meta.transliteration: walaw nashāu laṭamasnā ʿalā aʿyunihim fa-is'tabaqū al-ṣirāṭa fa-annā yub'ṣirūna
